{"step_by_step_thinking": "Glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) is a well-known enzyme involved in glycolysis. However, it has also been found to have other functions in different organisms. In the context of pathogenic bacteria, GAPDH has been reported to act as a plasminogen receptor, which aids in the bacteria's invasion and infection processes.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
